latestIgtvVideos.caption: The microbiome is the source of some of the most exciting research in medicine. New discoveries point to its impact on autoimmune disease, diabetes, cancer, depression and more. Akkermansia is one of the most important keystone species in the gut and helps regulate glucose, weight, metabolism and more. One of the proteins produced by Akkermansia works on the GLP-1 receptors (just like Ozempic, but without the side effects) to regulate blood sugar and weight. Pendulum (who makes Akkermansia) is offering my community 20% off your first month of any Pendulum membership. Visit pendulumlife.com and use code HYMAN at checkout. #sponsored

C15:0 is the first essential fatty acid to be discovered since omega-3, more than 90 years ago. And it’s difficult to get from food sources unless you’re chugging a lot of whole-fat cow’s milk—which contains way more proinflammatory fats that compete with C15:0’s health benefits. 

Learn more about the incredible science behind this long-lost fat and the important role it has in your long term health at fatty15.com (@fatty15). Listeners can use my discount DRHYMAN10 for 10% off your order.  #sponsored

latestIgtvVideos.title: AX3 Astaxanthin
latestIgtvVideos.caption: I recently discovered a revolutionary longevity supplement called AX3 Astaxanthin that’s backed by some amazing science, yet it’s still relatively unknown in the general population. This naturally occurring super-nutrient fights oxidative stress and inflammation, protects against mitochondrial dysfunction, and promotes overall well-being at a cellular level. My friends at @ax3.life are committed to helping you be your best self longer. AX3 is offering 20% off your first order of AX3® Bio-Pure Astaxanthin at ax3.life/hyman with code HYMAN Start your longevity journey with AX3 today.

You might’ve seen attacks against me because I had a company called @apeel_sciences sponsor a few of my podcasts years ago. People claim there was glyphosate in this product, which is simply designed to protect vegetables and fruits from rotting and address the problem of Food Waste.

Food waste is an enormous problem that affects all of us. We waste 40% of the food that we grow. The cost of that food waste is over $2 trillion globally every year.  To grow that food would take the entire landmass of China every year. 

This conversation with the founder @jamestrogers_ explains the controversy. Apeel simply uses ingredients from plants to create a second peel for a fruit or vegetable, preserving it and increasing the nutrient density.

He tested the products through a third-party, and there was no glyphosate or any other chemicals found. In fact, the entire process of creating Apeel is through distillation, which eliminates all environmental chemicals and toxins. 

Do your homework, and you’ll find that  @apeel_sciences is a company trying to solve a big problem. And to be clear I have no financial connection with them at all other than them being a sponsor for a few of my podcast years ago. 

#doyourhomework #be-curious

Everyone's been talking about GLP-1 lately and its implications for managing weight. Today, I spoke with Colleen Cutcliffe, PhD, Co-Founder and CEO of @pendulumlifeco, all about GLP-1 and how you can support it with probiotics. We already know that Akkermansia muciniphila is a beneficial bacteria that makes up to 4% of a healthy gut microbiome. Well now we have yet another reason to love this keystone strain. In our conversation, Colleen explains how Akkermansia has also been shown to actually increase GLP-1 based on in vitro studies. latestPosts.caption:
You’re never too old to start building muscle.

Muscle acts as a metabolic reservoir, storing and utilizing glucose efficiently, preventing insulin resistance, and protecting against chronic disease. 

The study found that muscle mass (not BMI) was the strongest predictor of survival, independent of fat mass, cardiovascular risk factors, and metabolic markers.

I used to think lifting weights was just for bodybuilders, I didn’t love the gym and thought cardio was enough. 

But when I learned that strength training activates longevity pathways like mTOR and AMPK, protects mitochondria, and triggers the release of myokines (hormone-like compounds that reduce inflammation and enhance brain function) I realized it wasn’t just about looking fit. 

It was about living longer, stronger, and healthier.

DOI: 10.1016/j.amjmed.2014.02.007
latestPosts.alt: Photo by Mark Hyman, M.D. on August 04, 2025. May be a Twitter screenshot of 1 person and text that says 'Mark Hyman, M.D. @drmarkhyman Strength training is like life insurance. A study found that older adults with more muscle had a 19% lower risk of premature death. Muscle mass, not BMI, was the strongest predictor of longevity. Muscle is the currency of longevity. The stronger you are, the better you age.'.

latestPosts.caption:
This is my breakfast smoothie! 🫐 what I call my “longevity shake.”

Do you need all of these ingredients? No.
Sometimes I keep it simple.
But I recently had back surgery, was on strong antibiotics, and I’m focusing on restoring my gut health, supporting my muscles, and optimizing recovery.

Here’s what’s in it:
-Goat whey protein: 40–50g protein, gentle on digestion
-Creatine: muscle + brain support
-Himalayan tartary buckwheat: nutrient-dense superfood
-Prebiotic fiber + immunoglobulins: gut repair
-Urolithin A: supports healthy aging
-Wild blueberries: antioxidant-rich
-Almond milk: no gums or emulsifiers

This takes just a few minutes to make, keeps my appetite steady, fuels my body with 40–50g of protein, and supports my metabolism, all without the processed additives that can take a toll on your health over time.

Starting your day with real, nutrient-dense food sets the tone for your entire day and your long-term health.

What do you usually add to your morning smoothie?👇

“Eating this ultraprocessed food may be good for you and the planet,” says CNN.
Right. And drinking Diet Coke is hydration.

Let me explain what’s actually happening when you ingest these products:

A Beyond Burger contains ~20+ engineered ingredients: pea/soy protein isolates (often extracted with solvents like hexane), methylcellulose (the same thickener used in wallpaper paste that your body can’t digest), “natural flavors” (a catch-all for lab-created compounds companies don’t have to disclose), cultured dextrose (a fermentation product that can include MSG-like compounds), and modified starches (chemically altered fillers). 

Impossible adds soy leghemoglobin,  a GMO yeast–derived “bleeding” agent that wasn’t in the human food supply before 2019.

When these hit your system, your body responds like it does to any ultra-processed food: inflammatory cascades, blood-sugar dysregulation, and gut-microbiome disruption. Your metabolism doesn’t magically treat a plant patty differently because the label says “plant-based.”

Quick label check: If it needs a lab to make it, a paragraph-long ingredient list to explain it, or words like isolates, modified starches, gums, or “natural flavors,” it’s ultra-processed. Real food reads like a recipe, not a chemistry set.

Don’t believe every headline. These are still ultra-processed foods… they hit your metabolism like a Cheeto with better PR.

If you’re plant-based, stick to actual plants: vegetables, legumes, nuts, seeds, olive oil, herbs, and minimally processed staples. If you eat meat, choose regeneratively raised options. 

Your body has evolutionary wisdom about real food. Trust it over marketing headlines.

Terms and conditions apply: your digestive system must agree to process wallpaper paste. 三 CNN Health Subscribe Eating this ultraprocessed food may be good for you and the planet, experts say'.

latestPosts.caption:
This is a national crisis.

New CDC data confirms: Nearly 1 in 3 teenagers now has prediabetes or type 2 diabetes.

When I graduated medical school, we called it “adult onset diabetes” because it ONLY affected adults. We had to change the name to “type 2 diabetes” because now we’re seeing it in children as young as 2 years old.

This represents nothing less than a national emergency, one that’s crippling our country economically (accounting for 1 out of every 5 dollars in our economy) and robbing our children of their futures. The average obese child faces a 13-year shorter life expectancy.

But here’s what gives me hope: Food is the most powerful drug we have.

I’ve worked with countless patients who’ve reversed their diabetes by addressing the root causes, insulin resistance and inflammation. I’ve seen people go from daily insulin injections to completely normal blood sugar without medication, simply by changing their diet and lifestyle.

Research shows 91% of type 2 diabetes cases are preventable through diet and lifestyle alone.

We have the tools. We have the knowledge. We just need to start treating the root cause instead of managing symptoms.

Drop a YES below if you want to join my community that helps you stay consistent with your health goals. ✨

Small, consistent changes win over big, dramatic overhauls.

A randomized controlled trial published in the European Journal of Social Psychology found that participants using a habit-based intervention focusing on ONE simple daily behavior lost 2kg compared to just 0.4kg in the control group after 8 weeks. 

At 32 weeks, those sticking with single habit formation had lost an average of 3.8kg and maintained their results.

The key is repeating one self-chosen, health promoting behavior in response to a single, once-daily cue in a consistent context until it becomes automatic… This usually happens within 10 weeks.

Small habits you can start today (pick one):
• Drink a glass of water immediately when you wake up
• Take 3 deep breaths before every meal
• Walk for 2 minutes after lunch
• Write down one thing you’re grateful for before bed
• Do 5 bodyweight squats while your coffee brews

The magic isn’t in the habit itself - it’s in the consistency. Pick ONE. Same time, same place, every day. Let me know if you’ll try this 👇

Drop a YES below and I’ll DM you a link to join the Hyman Hive
latestPosts.alt: Photo by Mark Hyman, M.D. on August 01, 2025. May be a Twitter screenshot of 1 person and text that says 'Mark Hyman, M.D.o @drmarkhyman Studies show that those who focus on just ONE consistent health choice daily are significantly more likely to maintain long-term behavior change, than those trying to change multiple habits all at once. Your body doesnt need perfection. It needs consistency.'.

latestPosts.caption:
Drop a YES below, and I’ll DM you a link to my new 10 Day Detox Essentials Guide: a quick PDF with everything you need to know to reclaim your health in just 10 days.

If there were a drug that could reduce symptoms from nearly every chronic condition by 70% in just 10 days, it would be bigger than Ozempic.

But that “drug” already exists. It’s called food.

When you eliminate ultra-processed junk, sugar, refined flours, and inflammatory triggers and replace them with real, whole foods like protein, vegetables, nuts, seeds, and berries, your body starts to heal. Fast.

I’ve seen it over and over again:
✔ Sinus issues clear up
✔ Migraines disappear
✔ Bloating, IBS, and joint pain fade
✔ Skin clears
✔ Energy and mood soar

There’s no calorie counting. Just nutrient-dense, delicious food designed to lower inflammation and help your body do what it was designed to do: function optimally.

You can do anything for 10 days.
And once you see how good you’re meant to feel, there’s no going back.

👇 Drop a YES below and I’ll send it your way

As temperatures rise, your desire might dip. But keep your cool (literally)—it’s totally normal.

For both men and women, higher temperatures can bring on heat-related fatigue, disrupted sleep, and cortisol spikes—all of which may suppress your sex drive.

Along with the discomfort of sweating and heat-induced irritability, it’s not out of the norm to feel less in the mood.

Not medical advice. Consult a medical professional with any medical questions. For marketing purposes only.

latestPosts.caption:
A massive new meta-analysis just dropped in The Lancet Public Health, and it’s redefining what we thought we knew about daily step counts.

Based on data from over 160,000 people across 57 studies:
 7,000 steps a day =
 → 47% lower risk of death
 → 25% lower risk of heart disease
 → 38% lower risk of dementia

The biggest health benefits started at just 5,000–7,000 steps per day. And every step beyond 2,000 was associated with reduced disease risk.

The average American walks fewer than 5,000 steps a day. That means most people are already closer to the “sweet spot” than they think.

If you can, aim for 5,000 to 7,000 steps daily. And if you want to go beyond that, great. The more you move, the better.

What’s your daily step count? Did these findings surprise you?

latestPosts.caption:
Can a ketogenic diet rewire the brain in bipolar disorder?

New research suggests it can, by lowering glutamate, a neurotransmitter that’s often elevated in epilepsy, bipolar, and schizophrenia. That’s why keto was originally used to treat seizures… and now, it’s being revisited as a breakthrough treatment for mental illness.

In today’s episode, I talk with Dr. Iain Campbell, neuroscientist, bipolar patient, and lead researcher at the University of Edinburgh, about why mental illness may actually be a metabolic brain disorder.

Here’s what we cover:
• How bipolar symptoms may stem from mitochondrial dysfunction
• Why glutamate matters and how keto affects it
• The history of using keto to treat epilepsy and diabetes
• What a $3M clinical trial hopes to prove
• And how this new science could change psychiatry forever
So much more!

This conversation will challenge everything you thought you knew about mental health and offer real hope for those who’ve been failed by conventional treatments.

🎧 Episode is out now. Drop a YES below and I’ll DM you the link to listen!

Think intimacy is all in your head? Think again.

Your thyroid doesn’t just impact mood and metabolism—it can shape desire and satisfaction.

Intimacy is physiological, not just mental.

If things feel off, test your thyroid.

Not medical advice. Consult a medical professional with any medical questions. For marketing purposes only.

latestPosts.caption:
Is bipolar disorder a metabolic illness?

That’s exactly what a growing number of researchers, including Dr. Iain Campbell are starting to uncover. And a groundbreaking new study from the University of Edinburgh could change everything we thought we knew about treating mental illness.

- Bipolar disorder affects over 40 million people worldwide.
- Current treatments often fail, and come with devastating side effects.
- But what if the root cause isn’t “just” in the brain... but in the body’s energy metabolism?

New research in metabolic psychiatry is revealing that disrupted mitochondrial function, insulin resistance, and inflammation may be driving bipolar disorder, just like they do in diabetes, Alzheimer’s, and other chronic diseases.

A ketogenic diet, used therapeutically, may help reverse symptoms in some patients. This episode will change the way you think about mental health!

Drop a YES below for an exclusive first look.

Alcohol might feel like a way to unwind, but the truth is, it’s a neurotoxin with serious consequences for your brain and body. 

Once consumed, alcohol is converted into acetaldehyde, a toxic compound that drives inflammation and oxidative stress, damaging key brain regions responsible for memory and decision making.

Even moderate drinking has been shown to shrink brain volume and impair cognitive function. And yes, I know this sucks…I love my tequila too. But I keep it to no more than about 2 drinks per month because protecting my brain is worth it.

If you do drink, prioritize your recovery:
- Get high-quality sleep.
- Focus on nutrient-dense, whole foods.
- Consider brain-supportive supplements like omega-3s, magnesium, and antioxidants.
- Hydrate with electrolytes (not just water).

The occasional drink doesn’t have to derail your health, but the more mindful you are, the better your brain (and body) will be. Share this with someone who needs to hear it!
latestPosts.alt: Photo by Mark Hyman, M.D. on July 29, 2025. May be an image of alcohol and text that says 'There's truly no "safe" amount of alcohol for brain health. Even moderate drinking can lead to measurable reductions in brain volume and function.'.
